item.title: Best Black Ops 6 Controller Settings: Aiming, Combat, Movement & more
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/best-black-ops-6-controller-settings-aiming-combat-movement/

If you’re playing Call of Duty Black Ops 6 using a controller and want to dominate the multiplayer lobbies, you must use the best aiming, combat, and movement settings.

No matter if you’re playing on a console or on a PC with a controller, the settings we have mentioned below will give you a good balance of speed, movement, and aiming precisions. Use them and you’ll also put Omnimovement to the best of the uses.

  • Best Controller settings
  • Best Aiming settings
  • Best Movement settings
  • Best Combat settings

Best Black Ops 6 Controller settings

Input Device

  • Aiming Input Device: Controller

Inputs

  • Button Layout: Default Flipped
  • Stick Layout Preset: Default
  • Horizontal Stick Sensitivity: 7
  • Vertical Stick Sensitivity: 6
  • Simplified Controls Preset: Off
  • Low Motor Strain Preset: Off
  • Bumper Ping: Off
  • Swap L1/R1 or LB/RB with L2/R2 or LT/RT: Off

Controller

  • Controller Vibration: Off
  • Trigger Effect: Off
  • Deadzone Inputs
    • Test Stick Deadzone: Off
    • Left Stick Min: 1
    • Left Stick Max: 75
    • Right Stick Min: 1
    • Right Stick Max: 99
    • Left Trigger: 0
    • Right Trigger: 0

Best Black Ops 6 Aiming settings

Aiming

  • Sensitivity Multiplier
    • 3rd Person Sensitivity Multiplier: 1
    • Ground Vehicles Sensitivity Multiplier: 1
    • Air Vehicles Sensitivity Multiplier: 1
    • Tablet Sensitivity Multiplier: 1
    • ADS Sensitivity Multiplier: 0.85
    • ADS Sensitivity Multiplier (Focus): 1
  • Look Inversion (On Foot): Standard
  • Aiming Advanced Settings
    • Aim Response Curve Type: Dynamic
    • Custom ADS Sensitivity Per Zoom: Off

Aim Assist

  • Target Aim Assist: On

Motion Sensor

  • Motion Sensor Behavior: Off

Best Black Ops 6 Movement settings

Intelligent Movement

  • Sprint Assist: Tactical Sprint Assist
  • Mantle Assist: Off
  • Crouch Assist: Off
  • Corner Slice: On

Movement Behaviors

  • Slide/Dive Behavior: Hybrid
  • Auto Door Peek: Off
  • Automatic Airborne Mantle: Off
  • Sprint Restore: On
  • Slide Maintains Sprint: On
  • Parachute Automatic Behavior: Off
  • Mantle Cancels Reload: On
  • Movement Advanced Settings
    • Sprint/Tactical Sprint Behavior: Toggle
    • Auto Move Forward: Off
    • Grounded Mantle: Off
    • Tactical Sprint Behavior: Single Tap Sprint
    • Plugging Underwater: Trigger
    • Sprinting Door Bash: On

Vehicle Behaviors

  • Vehicle Advanced Settings
    • Vehicle Control Mode: Aim-Based Control
    • Scorestreak Vehicle Control Mode: Aim-Based Control
    • Vehicle Camera Recenter: Short Delay
    • Camera Initial Position: Free Look
    • Lean-Out Activation: Melee/Finishing Move/Body Shield

Best Black Ops 6 Combat settings

Combat Behaviors

  • Aim Down Sight Behavior: Hold
  • Weapon Mount Activation: ADS+Melee
  • Dedicated Melee Weapon Activation: Hold Melee
  • Armor Plate Behavior: Apply All
  • C4 Detonation Activation: All at once
  • Equipment Behavior: Hold
  • Manual Fire Behavior: Press
  • Combat Advanced Settings
    • Focus Behavior: Hold
    • Change Dpad Up Behavior: Ping
    • Change Zoom Activation: Sprint/ Tactical Sprint/Focus
    • Weapon Mount Exit: Short Delay
    • Interact/Reload Behavior: Tap to Reload
    • Sprint Cancels Reload: Off
    • ADS Stick Swap: Off
    • Depleted Ammo Weapon Switch: On
    • Body Shield/Finishing Move Behavior: Prioritize Finishing Move

Overlay Behaviors

  • Scoreboard/Map/Stats Behavior: Toggle
  • Overlay Advanced Settings
    • Inventory Control: Directional Buttons
    • Ping Wheel Delay: Moderate
    • Double Tap Danger Ping Delay: Moderate
    • Wheels Behavior: Hold

item.title: Best Model L Loadout in Black Ops 6: Attachments, Perks & Equipment
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/best-model-l-loadout-in-black-ops-6-attachments-perks-and-equipment/

A fully automatic Assault Rifle with a lot of firepower, the best Black Ops 6 Model L loadout can do some serious damage across medium and large maps.

For those interested in taking advantage of the gun, here are the best Model L attachments, Perks, and Equipment to use.

  • Best attachments
  • Best Perks, Wildcard & Equipment
  • Best Secondary for Model L
  • How to unlock Model L in Black Ops 6
  • Is the Model L any good in Black Ops 6?
  • Best alternatives

Best Model L attachments in Black Ops 6

  • Optic: Merlin Mini
  • Muzzle: Suppressor
  • Barrel: Reinforced Barrel
  • Underbarrel: Extended Mag I
  • Rear Grip: Commando Grip

The Black Ops 6 Model L excels in medium-ranged engagements, with a slow fire rate that’s easy to control and consistent damage. The iron sights aren’t the best, so the Merlin Mini is a nice choice for Optic. Then, to keep you off the enemy’s radar, the Suppressor Muzzle is a vital option.

Boosting the damage range and bullet velocity is the Reinforced Barrel, making the weapon even more effective at range. Then, the Extended Mag I gives you more than enough bullets in a mag to finish off multiple enemies. Lastly, the Commando Grip improves handling with a decrease in aim down sight and sprint-to-fire speeds.

Best Perks, Wildcard & Equipment for Model L

  • Perk 1: Flak Jacket
  • Perk 2: Assassin
  • Perk 3: Double Time
  • Perk 4: Gung-Ho
  • Wildcard: Perk Greed
  • Lethal: Frag Grenade
  • Tactical: Stim Shot
  • Field Upgrade: Trophy System

Perks are a vital aspect of any loadout in BO6, and so we’ve chosen Assassin, Double Time, and Gung-Ho to get the Enforcer Combat Speciality. Then, Perk Greed allows you to select another Perk, and I find Flak Jacket to be a huge lifesaver, especially when enemies are lobbing grenades at the objective.

As for Equipment, Frag Grenades are a classic tool for catching enemies in enclosed spaces, while the Stim Shot keeps you topped up with health. Finally, we’ve gone with the Trophy System to support the team in capturing objectives.

Best Secondary for Model L

The best Secondary weapon for the Model L is the Grekhova, a fully automatic pistol that can support your battles in close-range situations. As the Model L is a long-range AR, this Secondary keeps you covered in those close-combat situations where you need something that has a faster fire rate and more mobility.

How to unlock Model L in Black Ops 6

You will unlock the Model L in Black Ops 6 by reaching Level 40. This will take some time, but by playing objective-based modes and gaining as much XP as possible, you should get there in a relatively fast fashion.

Check out our guide on how to rank up fast if you’re eager for tips on unlocking the gun quickly.

Is the Model L any good in Black Ops 6?

The Model L is great on medium and large-sized maps, but it isn’t he best at close ranges due to its slow fire rate. So, with that said, it’s an excellent AR but you’ll need to play to its strengths to get the most out of it.

Best alternatives to the Model L in Black Ops 6

The AK-74 is an optimal alternative to the Model L, offering a similar fire rate and damage profile. If you want something with a faster fire rate, the AMES 85 is one to look at.
